script: The hiking trip up the mountain was incredibly exhausting, but the views were worth it. We barely had any cell service out there in the woods. Ultimately, I felt so much more relaxed and grounded after the trip. It was exactly what I needed to disconnect from work.

options: To summarize the final, overarching consequence of an experience.
To complain about the terrible cell phone service on the mountain.
To forcefully argue that everyone needs to go hiking.
To apologize for ignoring emails from their boss.

explanation: The speaker uses 'Ultimately' to distill a complex experience down to its final, most significant outcome.
